result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis Lee McCloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $210.00 to Rex N. and to pay all court costs including the DNA surcharges to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016 until paid in full.  Any missed payments and the entire amount becomes due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid first.

*Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $210.00 to Rex N. and to pay all court costs including the DNA surcharges to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016 until paid in full.  Any missed payments and the entire amount becomes due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid first.
*If revoked, the Court ordered all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

*Court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in House of Correction pending his revocation hearing.
**04-06-16/JOC amended to reflect sentence is consecutive to any other sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis Lee McCloud

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC amended to reflect sentence is consecutive to any other sentence.
Decision and Order Denying Motion for Sentence Credit and Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. SPC
Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP
Amended defendant's first name to Louis on State's motion on 12/10/15 entry.

Defendant Lewis Lee McCloud in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Lewis Lee McCloud in custody.  Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   On State's motion Court amended defendant's first name to Louis.
Court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in House of Correction pending his revocation hearing.
Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $210.00 to Rex N. and to pay all court costs including the DNA surcharges to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016 until paid in full.  Any missed payments and the entire amount becomes due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid first.
If revoked, the Court ordered all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Victim Impact Statement

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Lewis Lee McCloud not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was not produced for today's plea and sentencing hearing.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis Lee McCloud in court with attorney Vince Guimont.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Guimont appears as new counsel.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Lewis Lee McCloud not in court, in custody.  Tim Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On motion of the defense Court allows Attorney Devitt to withdraw from the case.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Release Conditions Order; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Justice Point for processing.

Court CONVERTED the $250.00 signature bond to $250.00 cash bail with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  No specific orders made by the Court today.  Standard rules of Justice Point Pretrial Services to apply.

Court CONVERTED the $250.00 signature bond to $250.00 cash bail with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  No specific orders made by the Court today.  Standard rules of Justice Point Pretrial Services to apply.
Per the substitution of judge filed by defense against Judge Conen (post-rotation).  The newly assigned court is Judge Cimpl's Court.
filed by defense against Judge Conen (post-rotation).  The newly assigned court is Judge Cimpl's Court.

Defendant Lewis Lee McCloud in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
Court GRANTS request.

Court addressed bail:  Court CONVERTED the $250.00 signature bond to $250.00 cash bail with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  No specific orders made by the Court today.  Standard rules of Justice Point Pretrial Services to apply.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Defense filed a substitution of judge today.
The newly assigned court is Judge Cimpl's Court.
Case adjourned to 08-11-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 19, Judge Cimpl's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Lewis Lee McCloud not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Anne Devitt is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
Case adjourned to 07-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with REX N.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.

Defendant Lewis Lee McCloud in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Lewis Lee McCloud in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
